publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-978 Margaret Mitchell: BT Internet Green X Code-That the Parliament congratulates BT for producing the internet safety leaflet The Internet Green X Code and for establishing the online quiz to test children's knowledge of the code; commends the way in which BT has used innovative, interactive and educational ideas to make children aware of internet safety; notes that the code has been endorsed by the Children's Society, Barnardo's, Childline, National Children's Homes, the NSPCC, the Internet Watch Foundation, Parents Online and the Home Office, and is deeply concerned that the Scottish Executive has to date failed to introduce sexual grooming legislation to ensure that Scottish children are protected from the potential dangers of grooming over the internet in line with children in other parts of the UK. Supported by: Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Murdo Fraser*
S2M-978 BT Internet Green X Code (lodged on 27 February 2004) Christine Grahame*, Mr David Davidson*, Phil Gallie*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mary Scanlon*, Ms Sandra White*
S2M-978 BT Internet Green X Code (lodged on 27 February 2004) Bill Aitken*, Mr Brian Monteith*
S2M-978 BT Internet Green X Code (lodged on 27 February 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
S2M-978 BT Internet Green X Code (lodged on 27 February 2004) Chris Ballance*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-978 BT Internet Green X Code (lodged on 27 February 2004) Alex Neil*, John Swinburne*
S2M-978 BT Internet Green X Code (lodged on 27 February 2004) Shiona Baird*
S2M-978 BT Internet Green X Code (lodged on 27 February 2004) Miss Annabel Goldie*
